-- CHECK AND FIX USER DATA
-- Ensure admin@tvk.com has proper organization_id
-- ============================================================================
-- Run this in Supabase SQL Editor
-- ============================================================================

-- 1. Check current user data
SELECT
    id,
    email,
    full_name,
    role,
    organization_id,
    is_active
FROM users
WHERE email = 'admin@tvk.com';

-- 2. Check organizations table
SELECT id, name, slug FROM organizations;

-- 3. If user doesn't have organization_id, update it
-- First, get the organization ID (replace with your actual org ID from step 2)
DO $$
DECLARE
    v_org_id UUID;
    v_user_id UUID;
BEGIN
    -- Get first organization ID
    SELECT id INTO v_org_id FROM organizations LIMIT 1;

    -- Get user ID for admin@tvk.com
    SELECT id INTO v_user_id FROM users WHERE email = 'admin@tvk.com';

    -- Update user with organization_id if it's null
    IF v_user_id IS NOT NULL AND v_org_id IS NOT NULL THEN
        UPDATE users
        SET organization_id = v_org_id,
            role = 'admin',
            is_active = true
        WHERE email = 'admin@tvk.com';

        RAISE NOTICE 'User updated successfully!';
        RAISE NOTICE 'User ID: %', v_user_id;
        RAISE NOTICE 'Organization ID: %', v_org_id;
    ELSE
        RAISE NOTICE 'User or Organization not found!';
    END IF;
END $$;

-- 4. Verify the update
SELECT
    u.id,
    u.email,
    u.full_name,
    u.role,
    u.organization_id,
    o.name as organization_name,
    u.is_active
FROM users u
LEFT JOIN organizations o ON u.organization_id = o.id
WHERE u.email = 'admin@tvk.com';

QEEG workflow and external report
    ‚Ä¢     workflow: clinic creates patient ‚Üí performs QEEG skull‚Äëcap scan ‚Üí generates  file ‚Üí uploads EDF file against patient in the system ‚Üí super admin downloads EDF and manually uploads to external QEEG Pro / CS Core FFT system. 
    ‚Ä¢    QEEG Pro outputsDF reports (eyes open and eyes closed, ‚Äúlappellation‚Äù reports); Algorithm 1 uses data mainly from page 13 and page 24 of each report. 





3. Algorithm 1 ‚Äì inputs, calculation and output
    ‚Ä¢    Alg 1 works on Z‚Äëscores for eyes open and eyes closed, using absolute and relative power values per channel, extracted from the QEEG Pro reports (pages 13 and 24 for both EO/EC). 
    ‚Ä¢    The Excel ‚ÄúAlg 1‚Äù and ‚ÄúBinary scoring‚Äù sheets define:
    ‚Ä¢    7eters (e.g., focus & attention, stress, emotional regulation, burnout/fatigue, etc.).
    ‚Ä¢    Each ter has 3 sub‚Äëparameters whose binary scores combine into a percentage and final parameter score (e.g., 1/3 = 33%, etc.). 
    ‚Ä¢    Ria‚Äôs sample repora report‚Äù) is the worked example of Algorithm 1: it shows step‚Äëby‚Äëstep calculations from QEEG pages 13 & 24 ‚Üí sub‚Äëparameter scores ‚Üí parameter scores and normal/abnormal thresholds (e.g., less than a threshold = normal). 





4. NeuroSense report ‚Äì what the system must generate
    ‚Ä¢    The final NeuroSense report is the paid deliverable (~‚Çπ15,000) given to:
    ‚Ä¢    Patient (brain scan subject)
referring doctor
    ‚Ä¢    Neurologist for interpretation. 
    ‚Ä¢    The system must:
    ‚Ä¢    Computfor each of the 7 parameters from Algorithm 1 (based on sub‚Äëparameters and binary scoring).
    ‚Ä¢    Present only final scores and interpretations to the patient; internal math/step‚Äëby‚Äëstep equations need not appear. 
    ‚Ä¢    For each parameter in the NeuroSense report, content should include:
    ‚Ä¢    Parameter name and simple definition (patient‚Äëfriendly).
    ‚Ä¢    Final score for the parameterameters).
    ‚Ä¢    High‚Äëlevel implication/interpretation of that score (e.g., normal / low / high, brief explanation of what it means functionally). 



5. UI/UX and dashboard expectations
    ‚Ä¢    Ria confirmed that formatting of the internal calculation report does not need to be preserved; dev team has full creative freedom for UI/UX, as long as it is professional and understandable for patientand neurologists. 
    ‚Ä¢    Desired patient journey (analogy from blood‚Äëtest dashboards as shown bel‚Ä¢    Patient/clinic logs in and sees a dashboard with 7 parameters, each with a visual status (e.g., green/yellow/red).
    ‚Ä¢    On ‚Äúview details‚Äù the user sees what the parameter means, their score, and a short explanation.
    ‚Ä¢    A ‚ÄúDownload‚Äù button generates a polished PDF ‚Äì this is the NeuroSense report for that scan.

1.content:
About Dr. Sweta Adatia

Neurologist | Author | TEDx Speaker | Coach | Entrepreneur | Spiritual Seeker

Dr. Sweta Adatia is a distinguished neurologist at Gargash Hospital, Dubai, with a passion for stroke and migraine care. A recipient of over 13 gold medals in Medicine and Neurology, she holds a stroke fellowship from the University of Calgary and an MBA from the University of Cambridge. She has contributed to global healthcare initiatives, including Defeat NCD UN‚Äôs care funding program for LMICs.

An author of Future Ready Now and a pioneer in neuroscience-driven career mapping through Mybraindesign, Dr. Sweta has delivered 200+ workshops, impacting thousands worldwide. Beyond medicine, she is a multilingual musician, national table tennis champion, and certified in pranic healing, hypnotherapy, aura photography, and neurofeedback. With a deep interest in alternative medicine and spiritual sciences, she seamlessly blends science and mindfulness in her approach.
